New Records: Bam Adebayo has 194 career double-doubles and is 11 away from tying Alonzo Mourning for the second-best in franchise history
Key Match Events: Herro scored five points in 13-3 run in the second quarter that put the Heat ahead 51-34 with less than four minutes to play
Pre-Game Insights: NBA Commissioner Adam Silver said the league had reached an agreement with local organizers to play more games in Mexico
Post-Match Reflections: Bam Adebayo scored 20 of his 32 points in the first half and the Miami Heat beat the Washington Wizards 118-98
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in the 14th NBA regular-season game in Mexico
The Wizards host Golden State on Monday night, while the Miami return home to play Sacramento on Monday night
Others: Kel'El Ware added 15 points coming off the bench
Jaime Jaquez Jr. scored eight points in his first game playing in his father's country
Bilal Coulibaly led Washington (2-3) with 22 points
